snippet: Since September, Chinese ships have made regular visits into the waters as part of what analysts call a long-term strategy of wearing down Japan’s will to keep enforcing its claims.
abstract: Japan lodges protest with China’s top diplomat in Japan after three Chinese paramilitary ships remain in waters around disputed East China Sea islands for more than 28 hours, longer than any time since fight over area began in 2012.
lead_paragraph: Since September, Chinese ships have made regular visits into the waters as part of what analysts call a long-term strategy of wearing down Japan’s will to keep enforcing its claims.

headline.main: Japan Protests Over Ships From China in Island Dispute
headline.print_headline: Japan Protests Over Ships From China in Island Dispute
